definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Keep it in mind, and then turn your approach to the question on its head by asking not "Are stocks cheap?"
sentences.chinese: 把它牢牢记在心头，然后把话头从“股票便宜吗？”

sentences.english: He paused, and looked at his wife again.
sentences.chinese: 他停住话头，又看了看妻子。

sentences.english: The man who brings up a words brain in times before, take illegible of the sincerity hope persist to ask a way.
sentences.chinese: 先前提起话头的男子，带着隐隐的真诚祝福继续问道。

sentences.english: With this Samuel knows what Capri wants him to say next.
sentences.chinese: 话已至此，塞缪尔知道卡普瑞要他怎样接过话头。

sentences.english: He stopped and turned away angrily to light his cigar.
sentences.chinese: 他打住话头，气愤地转过身去点着雪茄。

sentences.english: I paused remembering the gun pointed at him.
sentences.chinese: 我打住话头，想起劫匪用枪指着他的情景。

sentences.english: The high-drinking friends, also up the thread of her conversation.
sentences.chinese: 喝高了的朋友，话头也多了起来。

sentences.english: He stopped. He looked at Eddie.

definition: erhua variant of 話茬|话茬[hua4 cha2]
to diverge/to branch off the road/to change (the subject)
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
to set off/to take to the road
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
